author: nacho

may be decoded by the servlet that uses it.

author: glenn
msg: Updated docs to reflect current implementation of the Java SecurityManager.

author: glenn
msg: <jsp:setProperty name="somename" property="someproperty" value=""/>
was not setting the value to an empty string, it just ignored it.
The syntax for jsp:setProperty 'property' explicitely states that
if a parameter has a value of "", the corresponding property is
not set.  But the syntax for 'value' does not.  From my reading
of the specs this means that a "" value is valid as long as
the property is not being set from a parameter.
A setProperty with an empty string now works.

author: craigmcc
msg: Fix the problem with relative nested includes, using the patch proposed by
Larry Isaacs.  The current codebase (including the previous patch for ".."
paths within a web application) passes all of the Watchdog tests.  I am next
going to install the updated test suite changes that Larry has also proposed
for the "/test" application that is part of Tomcat.
In the mean time, could Larry (and others) please check that I have correctly
fixed the nested includes problem, and not introduced any other errors?
Submitted by: Larry Isaacs <Larry.Isaacs@sas.com>
